sense.name: Form by hand manipulation or by pouring into a shaped container to harden, perhaps for a specific purpose.
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] MOULD NP2[material] (PP{into NP[product]}) NP1[agent] MOULD [product] (PP{from NP[material]})
sense.examples: Clara moulded a head with clay in art class. The artist moulded a bronze sculpture. She moulded the rice balls carefully. Mould cylinders from the dough. Mould the metal into a sword.

sense.name: Make suitable for a specific role or function.
sense.examples: He moulds his recruits from Day 1. We must mould our students for the world of commerce. She moulded the puppy into a wonderful dog.
